second_reading.text:
[[1_Co 10,31]]So whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do everything for the glory of God.
[[1_Co 10,32]]Avoid giving offense, whether to Jews or Greeks or the church of God,
[[1_Co 10,33]]just as I try to please everyone in every way, not seeking my own benefit but that of the many, that they may be saved.
[[1_Co 11,1]]Be imitators of me, as I am of Christ.
second_reading.title: First Letter to the Corinthians

first_reading.text:
[[Lv 13,1]]The LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
[[Lv 13,2]]"If someone has on his skin a scab or pustule or blotch which appears to be the sore of leprosy, he shall be brought to Aaron, the priest, or to one of the priests among his descendants,
[[Lv 13,44]]the man is leprous and unclean, and the priest shall declare him unclean by reason of the sore on his head.
[[Lv 13,45]]The one who bears the sore of leprosy shall keep his garments rent and his head bare, and shall muffle his beard; he shall cry out, 'Unclean, unclean!'
[[Lv 13,46]]As long as the sore is on him he shall declare himself unclean, since he is in fact unclean. He shall dwell apart, making his abode outside the camp."
first_reading.title: Book of Leviticus

psalm.text:
[[Ps 32,1]]Blessed is he whose fault is taken away, 
whose sin is covered.
[[Ps 32,2]]Blessed the man to whom the LORD imputes not guilt, 
in whose spirit there is no guile.

[[Ps 32,5]]Then I acknowledged my sin to you, 
my guilt I covered not. 
I said, “I confess my faults to the LORD,” 
and you took away the guilt of my sin.

[[Ps 32,11]]Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, you just; 
exult, all you upright of heart.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Mc 1,40]]A leper came to him and kneeling down begged him and said, "If you wish, you can make me clean."
[[Mc 1,41]]Moved with pity, he stretched out his hand, touched him, and said to him, "I do will it. Be made clean."
[[Mc 1,42]]The leprosy left him immediately, and he was made clean.
[[Mc 1,43]]Then, warning him sternly, he dismissed him at once.
[[Mc 1,44]]Then he said to him, "See that you tell no one anything, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing what Moses prescribed; that will be proof for them."
[[Mc 1,45]]The man went away and began to publicize the whole matter. He spread the report abroad so that it was impossible for Jesus to enter a town openly. He remained outside in deserted places, and people kept coming to him from everywhere.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
